mods.note: / Army and Navy Stores which explains itself. Sir Geoffrey Prior said that I might ask for your assistance to the Stores should they require it. Best wishes. F. A, K. Harrison, Esquire, India Office, London, r “ JAN A P,No. 206 BRITISH RESIDENCY AND CONSULATE GENERAL, BUSHIRE. the 12th January, 1946. To The Army and Navy Stores, Victoria Street, London, S. W. 1. Gentlemen. 1 / Please supply this Residency with the following : i. One Settee measuring : Top of arm to floor 22 ' length of arm, outside, front to back S2 ,l Vvidth between arms 54 ' Top of seat cushion to floor 16 H Length of back 59 *• Top of back to floor 30 ” Depth of seat, front to back 24. ,, ii. Three Easy chairs, each measuring j Top of back to floor 32 ” Width of back, at top 26 “ Top of arm to floor 20 M Width of seat between arms 19 ' Top of seat cushion to floor 16 11 Length of arm, outside, front to back 31 ** Depth of seat, front to back 24 ” iii. Three Pouffe 16 ' high. iv. Two single beds fitted with spring mattresses of the 'Vi-upring' or M Vosio M type. 2. The measurements given are intended as a guide to our requirements and exact compliance with them is not necessary. 3. The settee ana chairs should da counted on low castors and of the modern covered style (i.e. not with . visible 'legs')• 4. Communications for this Residency should be addressed by iilr Mall to the 'Secretary to the Hon*ble the Political Resiuent in the Persian Gulf, care of the Political Agent, Bahrain, Persian Gulf', and telegrams to 'BRITAIN BUSHIRE'. 5. It would be appreciated if you could inform us as soon as possible when these goods are likely to be despatched from England. 6. Should you need assistance in shipping or other export arrangements, please apply for assistance to Mr. F. A. K. Harrison of the India Office. 7. Enclosed is a draft for £ 100/- to be set off against your bill in due course.8. The goods should be consigned to 'the Hobble the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, care of the Political Agent, Bahrain, Persian Gulf'. 9. Copies of this letter are being sent to the Political Agent, Bahrain and Mr. F. A. K. Harrison. lours faithfally, Sd. a. J. Pelly, Secretary to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf. G.A.M. No. 208. Copy to F. Office, London. Bushire, the 12th January, 1946. A. K. Harrison, Esquire, India Secretary to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf.' CD 1 . in reply 9 th January -, 94 . 6 0423 8 /P. * Dear Sir, Further to our letter of yesterday 1 s date, we very much regret indeed that the letter from the Board of Trade was not enclosed, and hasten to send same herewith. Yours faithfully, P.P. BAKER & CO.LTD.' J r\ y'TBLEPHOHE-. GERRARD 6351* TE LEG R A MS: VIDALABAK, PIOCY. LONDON. PILE COP'V F. P. Baker & Co. Ltd. ‘ H AA~ CABLES: BANSHEE, LONDON. BENTLEYS CODE. (B> WAREHOUSES: 8-9, BRIDLE LANE, Dear Sir, Continuing our letter of the 6 th December 1945 and your telephone call with regard to the Cricklites which are to be supplied to The Residency, Bushire, as we told you we applied to the Board of Trade for an Export ^ Licence and this v'as refused. We are enclosing the original letter from the Board of Trade stating that they cannot issue a licence and we hope that this will enable you to bring pressure to bear. Yours faithfully, P.P. I am, however, to express regret that a licence^ cannot be issued for the export of these goods. I am, Your obedient Servant,Previous File P. POLITICAL (INTERNAL) DEPARTMENT. P.Y. 193 Subject: YEAR. This File contains the following papers :—

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 16; these numbers are written in pencil and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of correspondence between F P Baker & Co Ltd, the India Office, and the Board of Trade regarding an export licence application and arrangements for supplies to the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf, Bushire.
